text: Douglas Evans Coe (October 20, 1928 – February 21, 2017) was an American evangelical leader. He served as associate director of the Christian organization, The Fellowship, (also known as a family of friends in Christ, the prayer breakfast groups). He has also been called as the "stealth Billy Graham." He was born in Medford, Oregon. In 2005, Coe was named one of the 25 most influential Evangelicals in the United States by Time magazine.Van Biema, David, etc (February 7, 2005) Douglas Coe in "25 Most Influential Evangelicals in America" Time Retrieved on 2008 – June 14 Coe was an ordained Presbyterian elder and serves as a lay minister.Presbytery of Washington Records of 1970 ordinations Coe died in Annapolis, Maryland on February 21, 2017 from complications of a heart attack, aged 88. ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:American Christians Category:Writers from Oregon Category:People from Medford, Oregon
title: Douglas Coe
